topic.title: What is the best blogging engine for ZeroNet today?
topic.body: What is the best blogging engine for ZeroNet today?

1568208722_1HnepkYQUYxzgLMr1SYhWURoR2vs9.body: I can not upload my site to the network.

> [randomshits](#comment_97_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): What is the address of your site?

I do not know, I created a clone of the Zero Net blog, and created a post, I clicked on the green button.
After which, I received this error.

Oh thank you guys!
I immediately thought that this message means that no one has downloaded my site.

1568213753_1HnepkYQUYxzgLMr1SYhWURoR2vs9.body:
> [katian](#comment_37_13eeXNBJGKwigVYRxwb84VnS6adJ8o2BXx): Hi kiridu, i'm using a clone of this one : http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/

Hello! Open source?
I am only looking for free and open source projects.

> [katian](#comment_39_13eeXNBJGKwigVYRxwb84VnS6adJ8o2BXx): GNU General Public License v2.0 for this project : https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroBlog

Thanks, but I know about that.
And your blog is also on this engine?

> [filips](#comment_191_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): That site is clone of ZeroBlog (which is open source) but with some modifications. I don't know if that modifications are open source, but there is GitCenter repository from user that created that site and it is probably source of modified ZeroBlog.

Ok, thank you. I will continue my search.
